title: Cycling Plus July issue on sale now! Subscribe and receive a free Syncros Matchbox Coupe Cage worth £39.99
content:
It’s here! The Cycling Plus Bike of the Year issue is a bumper-size magazine that looks at 21 of the best bikes for 2021. The pandemic meant no exotic photoshoots this year but the team has still been able to test the bikes they wanted to, from £1775 to £11,750.

Special features this issue see the team debunk the cycling superstitions that run rife in professional cycling, and they talk to pro athletes who have made the leap into cycling from other sports. Plus there’s a free, 28-page supplement that has all the information on this year’s best sportives with tips on how to smash your next race.

  • Subscribe to Cycling Plus to receive your free gift as well as discounts and more

Bike of the Year

The long-awaited, annual big bike test is here and senior technical editor, Warren Rossiter, along with his intrepid team of testers, has been out in the wilds of Wiltshire testing 21 bikes that cover the endurance, performance, superbike and gravel categories. Find out which bike won each category plus the overall winner that took this coveted award.

Meals on wheels

Cycling Plus’s brave features editor, John Whitney, heads out for a ride with the formidable chef and author of The Cycling Chef series, Alan Murchison, in his South Downs home. John was fed some pretty tasty meals along the way too.

Size matters

The Cycling Plus team speak to four riders who prove that you don’t have to be whippet-thin in order to enjoy what should be an inclusive sport, and how taking to two wheels has transformed their lives for the better.

A race to the top

Alongside a comprehensive guide to the best sportives in 2021, the Cycling Plus team has created a 12-week training plan to get you match fit for your next race, and discuss the 10 best ways to boost your cycling.
